name: The Hin Gatling Gun: Cleric 32 / Monk 4 / Fighter 4
author: grizzled_dwarflord

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
And another Epic Halfling offering in my continued exploration of the Halfling race.  The Hin Gatling Gun was really more of a novelty, or a gimmick, of mine, but he may actually have legs.  I’ll let the Guild be the judge.  My apologies in advance, but I could not find an appropriate image of a halfling with a gatling gun.
 
Title: The Hin Gatling Gun
AKA: The Pipsqueak Catapult
AKA: Zen & the Art of Gatling Gun Maintenance
Classes: Cleric32/Ftr4/Monk4
Race: Halfling (Human can work in a pinch)
Alignment: Any Lawful
Playable: PVM 1-40 in environs that allow for buffing slings and ammo
XP Penalty: 20% from Level 20 on

Str 10
Int 14
Wis 16 (34)
Dex 16
Con 12

  • Hammer DC: 32 (38 max)
  • Blade Barrier DC: 34 (40 max)
  • Implosion DC: 40 (46 max)
 
Strengths:
  • Up to 6 Ranged Attacks per round at high AB
  • High Damage Output
  • Respected Caster Cleric with solid Evocation DCs
  • Good Saves
  • Great Naked AC
  • Dispel Proof
  • High Will Save
  • Evasion
  • Craft Wands of Darkfire, Haste, Invis and Improved Invis
  • Deflect Arrow
 
Weaknesses
  • 20% XP Penalty for half the build’s career
  • Reflex is low, but is mitigated by Spellcraft, Evasion, and Cleric Spells
  • Not a good melee combatant, but high AC and cleric buffs enable him to tank if needed
  • Limited Skill Set
  • No Discipline – there’s enough skill points to invest, but there’s little point since he won’t win that contest.  He must avoid situations involving KD or Disarm
 
Builder’s Commentary
Forgive me if this has already been done (hasn’t everything been done by now?), but I couldn’t find anything quite like this, at least not with this class and race split.  My goal was to exploit – no, exploit is a harsh word, I shall use “take advantage”—take advantage of the halfling’s AB bonus with slings (+1 for small stature and a further +1 for Good Aim (slings count as a thrown weapon in this regard).  This hin cleric gets a natural AB of 43 with a sling, 44 if within 15 feet (PBS range), and that is unbuffed.  If you do the math, this means you can get your AB up to 69 without breaking a sweat, and 70 if within 15 feet.  I then build upon this with Rapid Shot, Haste and Divine Power for an extra 3 attacks tagged onto his first 3 attacks.  The schedule breaks down as 67/62/57/67/62/57.  Each Bullet packing Darkfire and Greater Magic Weapon and Divine Favor, Battletide and Prayer, and supplemented with Epic Weapon Specialization and any Mighty and other properties your bullets might have.  With an Extended Divine Power and Haste, this mode will literally over 6 turns (3+ game hours with just one casting of each).
 
The caveat to this is that it only works in environments where you are allowed to buff slings and bullets.  In a vanilla NWN environment this is not an option, but any many modules and PWs this is a thing. Thus my avoidance in posting this in the Full Level 40 Builds section as it really isn’t possible to do this in the OCs.
 
32 Levels of Cleric are taken to be able to defeat standard Toolset Spell Resistance.  My reasoning is, if they can resist the spell, fine, but can they resist a barrage of mortar rounds raining down like hellfire?  With a high Wisdom and Epic Spell Focus in Evocation, he certainly can end a bad guy’s day with his spells if his sling is running up empty.  Craft Wand is taken so he never runs out of GMWs and Darkfire for his mortar rounds, as well as having never ending access to Haste, Invis, and Improved Invis quickslotted for your pleasure.
 
There’s a few feats I would like to have but couldn’t fit them in:  Blindfighting, Called Shot and Improved Crit, and Empower Spell.  You can mitigate Called Shot by managing the battlefield with SoVs, Hammers, Summons, etc.  As for blindfighting, if you are unable to hit a concealed creature, just drop a 46 DC Implosion.  That’ll learn them.
 
If one wants to avoid the Halfling XP penalty, one could go Human.  You’ll lose 2 AB, but you would be able to pick up one of the feats still on my wish list.  I’d probably go for Empower Spell.
 
For skill points, I was able to get everything I wanted and had 40 left over, so you have some leg room there to customize.  One may desire to put those into Discipline.  With his low strength and no skill foci, I didn’t see a point.  He needs to avoid melee in those cases anyway, but he still has a naturally high AC and Concealment to mitigate those circumstances.  One could argue to start with a 12 Int, and 14 Con instead (which I tried), but I missed those skill points (it was too tight).
 
Monk is not taken until epics to try to put off inevitable xp penalties for as long as possible.  It’s entirely possible that I am wrong in my calculations and there is a 40% xp penalty regardless of how I structured epic level developments. 
 
Finally, it is possible to squeeze in even more natural AB, but it would require some min maxing Wisdom and losing out on ESF: Evocation.  Not worth it in my opinion.  Alternatively, you may drop 2 Great Wisdoms and pick up 2 Epic Spell Feats—Greater Ruin and Epic Mummy would be my choice.
 
I welcome all comments for I believe there is way to still make her better. For instance, I was considering a Cleric29/Ftr6/Monk5 split to accelerate EWS in the build's career.  Same net amount of feats, same end wisdom, AC goes up by one.  The downside would be lowering Spell Penetration and shorter durations of spells.  Cheers my lads!

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
While I playtested this halfling extensively offline (in order to make sure I got the attack schedule right), I never bothered to look at the xp awarded.  My initial hypothesis is I could mitigate the 20% xp penalty by keeping Fighter and Monk within 2 of each other.  If human, this would have been correct, but the moment that first Fighter level is taken it inherits a 20%.  The moment that first Monk level hits, it becomes 40%.  That's a bit untenable, even for me.  But like I said, it was a bit of a gimmick (albeit a good one).

A few ways to mitigate this if one were still interested (and none of these are good):
Go Human.  Bring Wisdom to 18 and end with a Wis of 36 to offset the loss of 2 AB from not being Halfling.  Up side:  i more feat and 43 more skill points.  Downside.  Min/maxed, loss of AB.  AC is probably a wash.
Drop Fighter for Rogue.  Not ideal.  You lose 2 needed feats and EWS.  Still saddled with 20%
Drop Monk for Rogue.  Lose Monk Wisdom goodness.  Gain UMD.  Still 20%.  This is probably the best of the three options.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Dwarf Cleric / Fighter / Monk might be an option instead of human, one would avoid exp penalties until the first Monk lvl at level 22, and it would be 20%.

Halflings are pretty cool though. A Halfling Cleric / Fighter / Rogue version adds a little sneak attack and uncanny dodge (with 3-4 levels) which might be nice. You could even make space for an extra cleric level for an extra caster level, but this might delay uncanny dodge if you want a proper rogue skill dump late.
